fields.description: The Client and the renewer can hit a deadlock during close operation since closeFile() reaches back to the DFSClient#removeFileBeingWritten. This is possible if the client class close when the renewer is renewing a lease.
fields.summary: Lease renewal can hit a deadlock

comments.body: This patch calls removal only when necessary in endFileLease().

This deadlock was found during testing on our end about an year or so ago. The fix (attached patch) was deployed to our production clusters ever since and has had significant amount of run time.
Please take a look at HDFS-12757.

The test in HDFS-12757 looks like a good repro for this.
I would add it here.

bq. I would add it here.
Agree. CC: [~yangjiandan], adding the UT patch from the JIRA  HDFS-12757 and possibly making it run for a shorter duration might be a good idea. Appreciate your thoughts on this. I can put a patch shortly combining the two based on your comments. Thanks lot!

Adding the test as it is causes a hang since the deadlock of the surefire process for this test class cannot recover or shutdown without external intervention. Thread joins or interrupts do not work therefore. Will update on more finds or ways to fix the test but would appreciate any more ideas from [~yangjiandan] / [~elgoiri]/ [~kihwal]. Thanks again.

Thank you for the comments [~yangjiandan]. I do an additional remove call for the LeaseRenewer in the case of socket time out, which makes it so that a later get() call will return a new renewer instance for a dfsclient. Also the patch adds your test for completeness.

v2 patch fixes dead lock and looks good to me, [~elgoiri] [~cheersyang] [~kihwal] Do you have any opinion?

v3 patch that fixes the test failures in testDistributedFileSystem which were related.
The issue is that as per the latest change, a new renewer is issues for out3 in testDfsClient and that does not pick up the config changes to graceperiod. I have added a test-only change for this since removing the lease renewer with a check for running clients was taken out. Appreciate any ideas on the latest patch.

Thanks Kuhu for the fix and others for the discussions.

I agree HDFS-12757 and this one is the same issue. Basically the {{DFSOutputStream}} object lock and the {{LeaseRenewer}} object lock can be held in reverse order by the a {{DFSOutputStream#close}} call and the {{LeaseRenewer#run}} thread. The fix here is to close the output streams out of the lease renewer lock, since the leaser renewer lock is just protecting the state of its member variables. LGTM overall.

Some comments:
- Checkstyle should be fixed.
- I would suggest to also polish the test a little bit, by using a more determined delay mechanism than {{Thread.sleep(3000)}}. Maybe we can also change the injector method from {{sleepWhenRenewLeaseTimeout}} to {{delayWhenRenewLeaseTimeout}}. (IMO the name {{sleepBeforeHedgedGet}} isn't a good example to follow)
- Please use a higher test timeout value like 2 mins, to be more robust when other deadly hdfs tests slow down jenkins machines.

Thanks for clarifying [~yangjiandan], sorry if I wasn't articulating clearly. I think we're saying the same thing here: {{dfsClient.closeAllFilesBeingWritten}} out of the LeaseRenewer's {{synchronized}} block, which eliminates the previous sequence that could lead to the deadlock.

Thank you for the review [~xiaochen]. I will address the test related changes soon, although checkstyle change that remains seems unnecessary as I mentioned earlier.
Also,
bq. I think we're saying the same thing here: dfsClient.closeAllFilesBeingWritten out of the LeaseRenewer's synchronized block, 
This is already being done in the v7 patch. The closeAll Files lock is not exercised from within the LeaseRenewer lock. What am I missing here?
Attaching patch that improves the test for better coordination between leaseRenewer and the dfsClient using a latch. Fixed the visibility to the grace default to private.
